string.text: 恰恩库夫是库尔尼克堡的一个村庄。村民们在这里进行了大量的努力，种植桑树，以养殖蚕，这是该地区一种有利可图的产品。
比得哥什是库尔尼克堡的一个村庄。这里是王国中最肥沃的地区之一，出产优质的小麦。
居斯特罗是普雷茨堡的一个村庄。村民们在这里进行了大量的努力，种植桑树，以养殖蚕，这是该地区一种有利可图的产品。
什切青是普雷茨堡的一个村庄。村民们黎明时分出发，捕捉跃过岩石的鲑鱼，以及在海中捕捞鲱鱼和鳕鱼。
列日是海斯韦克堡的一个村庄。这里的居民饲养牛只，其牛奶和黄油受到经过该地区的商人和旅行者的青睐。
鲁尔蒙德是海斯韦克堡的一个村庄。这里是王国中最肥沃的地区之一，出产优质的小麦。
奥格斯堡是库夫施泰因堡的一个村庄。这里的居民饲养牛只，其牛奶和黄油受到经过该地区的商人和旅行者的青睐。
谢尔丁是库夫施泰因堡的一个村庄。这里的村民主要通过养羊获得大部分收入。
勃兰登堡是弗里德兰堡的一个村庄。村民们在这里进行了大量的努力，种植桑树，以养殖蚕，这是该地区一种有利可图的产品。
扎雷是弗里德兰堡的一个村庄。这里的居民饲养牛只，其牛奶和黄油受到经过该地区的商人和旅行者的青睐。
辛斯海姆是尼德阿尔丁根堡的一个村庄。这个村庄靠近山中的一条富含银矿的矿脉。
纽伦堡是尼德阿尔丁根堡的一个村庄。这里的居民饲养牛只，其牛奶和黄油受到经过该地区的商人和旅行者的青睐。
霍多宁是红石城堡的一个村庄。这里的居民饲养牛只，其牛奶和黄油受到经过该地区的商人和旅行者的青睐。
多瑙斯特雷达是红石城堡的一个村庄。这里的居民饲养牛只，其牛奶和黄油受到经过该地区的商人和旅行者的青睐。
奥帕瓦是波佐夫堡的一个村庄。该地区的矿山为王国的许多铁匠铺提供铁矿石。
波伊斯多夫是波佐夫堡的一个村庄。该地区专门采伐木材，木材通过河流漂流下来并出售给附近的城镇。
莱比锡是布拉克堡的一个村庄。该地区的矿山为王国的许多铁匠铺提供铁矿石。
不来梅是布拉克堡的一个村庄。村民们收获高地上的高大树木，将木材出售给附近的城镇。
格但斯克坐落在波罗的海沿岸，位于格但斯克湾的南端，靠近维斯瓦河。
兹沃图夫是格但斯克的一个村庄。该地区的矿山为王国的许多铁匠铺提供铁矿石。
比亚沃加德是格但斯克的一个村庄。这里是格但斯克最肥沃的地区之一，出产优质的小麦。
斯武普斯克是格但斯克的一个村庄。这里的村民捕捞金枪鱼、沙丁鱼、鲣鱼和鲨鱼。
汉堡坐落在易北河旁，易北河流入北海。
平讷贝格是汉堡的一个村庄。村民们黎明时分出发，捕捉跃过岩石的鲑鱼，以及在海中捕捞鲱鱼和鳕鱼。
什未林是汉堡的一个村庄。这个村庄靠近山中的一条富含银矿的矿脉。
科隆坐落在莱茵河旁，莱茵河流入北海。
多特蒙德是科隆的一个村庄。这里是王国中最肥沃的地区之一，出产优质的小麦。
恩斯赫德是科隆的一个村庄。山坡的土壤为马匹提供了优质的放牧场。
维也纳位于阿尔卑斯山脉的最东端，处于维也纳盆地，靠近多瑙河。
杰尔是维也纳的一个村庄。村民们在河中放置渔网，捕捉各种鱼类。
巴登是维也纳的一个村庄。村民们收获高地上的高大树木，将木材出售给附近的城镇。
布拉格坐落在伏尔塔瓦河旁，位于布拉格高原上。
斯特拉科尼采是布拉格的一个村庄。该地区丰富的草地使其成为优质的马匹养殖地。
茨韦特尔是布拉格的一个村庄。该地区丰富的草地使其成为优质的马匹养殖地。
卢巴夫卡是布拉格的一个村庄。村民们在这里进行了大量的努力，种植桑树，以养殖蚕，这是该地区一种有利可图的产品。
斯特拉斯堡坐落在莱茵河旁，位于上莱茵平原，西侧是沃尔日山的高地，东侧是黑森林。
伯尔尼是斯特拉斯堡的一个村庄。村民们在这里进行了大量的努力，种植桑树，以养殖蚕，这是该地区一种有利可图的产品。
特里尔是斯特拉斯堡的一个村庄。低洼的土地适合种植亚麻。
卡萨雷霍斯是马加尼亚堡的一个村庄。当地的土地拥有者建立了种马场，为骑兵提供马匹。
图德拉是马加尼亚城堡的一个村庄。低洼的海岸线非常适合建造盐田。
布拉干萨是蒙福特堡的一个村庄。这片土地富含小麦。
阿马兰蒂是蒙福特堡的一个村庄。这片土地富含小麦。
科鲁希是埃武拉山堡的一个村庄。该地区的葡萄酒异常甜美且浓烈，在王国中备受珍视。
贝雅是埃武拉山堡的一个村庄。该地区的葡萄酒异常甜美且浓烈，在王国中备受珍视。
巴兰克特是奥里韦拉堡的一个村庄。村民们收集雨水和山坡上的径流，用于灌溉他们的田地和棕榈树园。
韦斯卡尔是奥里韦拉堡的一个村庄。这个地区的葡萄酒异常甜美且浓烈，在王国中受到高度赞赏。
萨莫拉是比利亚帕迭纳堡的一个村庄。该地区的葡萄酒异常甜美且浓烈，在王国中备受珍视。
巴利亚多利德是比利亚帕迭纳堡的一个村庄。这里的村民主要通过养羊获得大部分收入。
卡塞雷斯是阿兰赫堡的一个村庄。村民们在山坡上种植橄榄。
塔拉鲁维亚斯是阿兰赫堡的一个村庄。该地区的葡萄酒异常甜美且浓烈，在王国中备受珍视。
伊利亚纳是阿韦特塔堡的一个村庄。该地区的葡萄酒异常甜美且浓烈，在王国中备受珍视。
莫利纳-德阿拉贡是伊利亚纳的一个村庄。该地区的矿山为王国的许多铁匠铺提供铁矿石。
布哈拉洛斯是铁拉斯堡的一个村庄。这个村庄靠近山丘中的一条丰富的银矿脉。
乌埃斯卡是铁拉斯堡的一座村庄。该地区的矿山为王国的许多铁匠铺提供铁矿石。是蒂巴斯城堡的一座村庄。该地区的矿山为王国的许多铁匠铺提供铁矿石。
瓦伦西亚位于地中海西海岸，位于伊比利亚半岛东部
阿尔瓦塞特是瓦伦西亚的一个村庄。这一地区的土壤较薄，但村庄在养猪和其他牲畜方面表现良好。
拉塞尼亚是瓦伦西亚的一个村庄。村民们采伐高地的高大树木，将木材出售给沿海城镇。
里斯本位于塔霍河的河口，位于伊比利亚半岛的西部。
蓬巴尔是里斯本的一个村庄。当地的土地拥有者建立了种马场，为骑兵提供马匹。
托马尔是里斯本的一个村庄。这里的土地富饶，适合种植小麦。
佩纳马科尔是里斯本的一个村庄。这里的土地富饶，适合种植小麦。
每个王国都有一个城市，其居民因其地方的粗俗而受到嘲讽，而对于帝国来说，这个城市就是塞维利亚。作为第一个在佩拉西克海内陆建立的帝国殖民地之一，它为帝国提供了征服西方帕莱克部落的基地。帕拉维诺斯乐于接受从其驻军送来的掠夺品和奴隶，但在背后嘲笑他们。这种情况在贾尔玛里亚将军卡尔索斯发动军事政变时发生了变化。当一位因其浓重口音而受阻的参议员紧张地请他重复一项法令时，他拔出剑说道：“你明白这个吗？”
奥苏纳是塞维利亚的一个村庄。山坡上的土壤非常适合马匹放牧。
波索布兰科是塞维利亚的一个村庄。这片土地富含小麦。
巴塞罗那位于伊比利亚半岛东北部的地中海西海岸。
菲格雷斯是巴塞罗那的一个村庄。该地区以小麦和大麦的生产而闻名。
法尔塞特是巴塞罗那的一个村庄。低洼的海岸线非常适合建造盐田。
阿尔法拉斯是巴塞罗那的一个村庄。这个村庄靠近山中的一条丰富的银矿脉。
圣地亚哥坐落在西北伊比利亚半岛，靠近安卡雷斯山脉。
卢戈是圣地亚哥的一个村庄。这片土地富饶，适合小麦的种植。
蓬费拉达是圣地亚哥的一个村庄。这里的丘陵土壤非常适合养马。
托莱多位于塔霍河旁，靠近中央山脉，位于瓜达拉马山脉以南，位于赫雷多斯山脉以西，位于伊比利亚半岛中央。
塔拉尤埃拉是托莱多的一座村庄。当地人饲养牛只，其牛奶和黄油受到经过该地区的商人和旅客的青睐。
拉索拉纳是托莱多的一座村庄。这里的土地富饶，适合小麦生长。
雷阿尔城是托莱多的一座村庄。这里的土地富饶，适合小麦生长。
阿尔瓦是纪尧姆堡的一座村庄。该地区专注于木材的收获，木材通过河流漂浮并出售给附近的城镇。
德拉吉尼昂是纪尧姆堡的一个村庄。这里是王国中最肥沃的地区之一，出产优质的小麦。
布雷西亚是圣乔治城堡的一座村庄。这是王国中最肥沃的地区之一，出产优质的小麦。
蒙塞利切是圣乔治城堡的一座村庄。村民们在这里努力种植桑树，以养殖蚕，这在该地区是一项利润丰厚的产品。
比通托是马萨夫拉堡的一座村庄。村民们在这里努力种植桑树，以养殖蚕，这在该地区是一项利润丰厚的产品。
波利科罗是马萨夫拉城堡的一座村庄。这个村庄靠近山丘中一条丰富的银矿带。
里窝那是博尼法乔堡的一座村庄。渔民们出海捕捞金枪鱼和沙丁鱼。
格罗塞托是博尼法乔城堡的一座村庄。这里是王国中最肥沃的地区之一，出产优质的小麦。
库特罗是伦巴第城堡的一座村庄。小溪从山上奔流而下，流经此地，可以找到优质的黏土。
阿格拉诺是伦巴第堡的一个村庄。村民通过开采附近的盐矿来谋生。
楚格是梅索科城堡的一座村庄。该村靠近山中丰富的银矿。
利岑是莫斯哈姆堡的一座村庄。村民们在这里进行了大量努力，种植桑树，以养殖蚕，这在该地区是一个盈利的产业。
费莱托是阿拉孔堡的一座村庄。这里是王国中最肥沃的地区之一，出产优质的小麦。
安科纳坐落在亚得里亚海的海岸，位于中阿彭尼尼山脉的北部。
卡斯特罗维拉里是安科纳的一个村庄。这个村庄靠开采附近的盐矿为生。
法布里亚诺是安科纳的一个村庄。羊群在俯瞰朦胧平原的低坡上放牧。
阿尼奥内是安科纳的一个村庄。小溪从山上奔流而下，那里有优质的粘土。
威尼斯位于浅水的威尼斯潟湖上，周围是一组岛屿，这些岛屿被开阔的水域分隔，并通过桥梁相连。
费拉拉是威尼斯的一个村庄。这是王国中最肥沃的地区之一，出产优质的小麦。
卢布尔雅那是威尼斯的一个村庄。这是王国中最肥沃的地方之一，并盛产优质小麦。
Pula is a village of Venezia. The village makes its living from mining nearby salt deposits.
Palermo sits on the coast of the Tyrrhenian Sea, in northwest Sicily island.
Canicattì is a village of Palermo. Coastal meadows, where tall grasses tolerant of the ocean salt spray thrive, support the rearing of fine horses.
Taurianova is a village of Palermo. The villagers here make most of their income from the raising of sheep.
Partanna is a village of Palermo. The villagers of this region specialize in the raising of pigs.
Roma sits in the middle of the Italian Peninsula, southwest of the middle Apennine Mountains.
Pontecorvo is a village of Roma. Sheep graze on the low slopes overlooking the hazy flatlands.
L'Aquila is a village of Alarcón Castle. Villagers harvest the tall trees of the heights, selling the logs to towns on the coast.
Firenze is a village of Roma. The hillside soils make fine grazing for horses.
Napoli sits on the west coast of the southern Italian peninsula.
Cerignola is a village of Napoli. Sheep graze on the low slopes overlooking the hazy flatlands.
Troia is a village of Napoli. The village makes its living from mining nearby salt deposits.
Carpino is a village of Napoli. The village makes its living from mining nearby salt deposits.
Genova sits on the coast of the Ligurian Sea, near the Apennine Mountains.
Pontremoli is a village of Genova. Decent clay can be found in the small streams that rush down from the hills.
Pavia is a village of Genova. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Vercelli is a village of Mesocco Castle. The grasses on the rolling downs are well-suited to the raising of sheep.
Cagliari sits on the coast of the Mediterranean Sea, in southern Sardinia island.
Sassari is a village of Cagliari. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Muravera is a village of Cagliari. Fishermen sail out into the sea for tuna and sardines.
Otočac is a village of Moosham Castle. The low-lying lands are suited to the growing of flax.
Hægebostad is a village of Tunsbergis Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Hønefoss is a village of Mjø Castle. Villagers grow flax in the muddy valleys between the hills in this cold, rainy land.
Mullsjö is a village of Läckö Castle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Laxå is a village of Läckö Castle. This region's rich grasses have made it a good horse country.
Finspång is a village of Stegeborg Castle. The villagers in these parts are expert trappers, hunting marten, fox, and rabbit for the rich pelts much in demand in the south.
Vimmerby is a village of Stegeborg Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Karlskoga is a village of Edsholms Castle. The muddy, low-lying land here is well suited to the growing of flax.
Mora is a village of Edsholms Castle. The villagers in these parts are expert trappers, hunting marten, fox, and rabbit for the rich pelts much in demand in the south.
Lofsdalen is a village of Kongsvinger Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Aalborg is a village of Kalø Castle. Villagers brave the storms that sweep through the sea to pull up ample catches of cod, char, and sometimes even small whales.
Lärbro is a village of Fardume Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Vossevangen is a village of Bergen. The villagers in these parts are expert trappers, hunting marten, fox, and rabbit for the rich pelts much in demand in the south.

Hamar is a village of Mjø Castle. Though this region is snowbound for much of the year, steppe ponies thrive on the spring grasses and in the winter dig through the snow for food, their thick coats protecting them from the icy blasts of wind.
Hyllestad is a village of Bergen. Today it is known for its daring fishermen, who venture out far to find banks, chilled by currents from the north, that are rich in cod.
Oslo lies on the arc of land at the northernmost end of the Oslofjord, in the southern Scandinavian Peninsula.
Prestestranda is a village of Oslo. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Larvik is a village of Oslo. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.
Torsby is a village of Kongsvinger Castle. Villagers net small spiny perch and crayfish in the streams, drying them for sale to travelers.
Göteborg sits on the coast of the Kattegat, an arm of the North Sea.
Trollhättan is a village of Göteborg. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Falkenberg is a village of Göteborg. Villagers brave the storms that sweep through the sea to pull up ample catches of cod, char, and sometimes even small whales.
Stockholm sits on the coast of the Baltic Sea, in the east-southern Scandinavian Peninsula.
Uppsala is a village of Stockholm. Villagers here fish for tuna, sardines, bonito, and sharks.
Visby is a village of Fardume Castle. The villagers in these parts are expert trappers, hunting marten, fox, and rabbit for the rich pelts much in demand in the south.
Södertälje is a village of Stockholm. The villagers of this region specialize in the raising of pigs.
Sandviken is a village of Stockholm. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.
Östersund sits east of the middle Scandinavian Mountains, inland the Scandinavian Peninsula.

Svenstavik is a village of Östersund. Snow-bound for much of the year, the spring grasses nonetheless sustain sizeable herds of sheep, the thick wool of which protects them from this land's icy winds.
Ljusdal is a village of Östersund. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Odense is a village of Kalø Castle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Sundsvall sits on the coast of the Gulf of Bothnia, in the eastern Scandinavian Peninsula.
Stugun is a village of Sundsvall. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Bräcke is a village of Sundsvall. The villagers in these parts are expert trappers, hunting marten, fox, and rabbit for the rich pelts much in demand in the south.
Ånge is a village of Sundsvall. Villagers harvest the tall trees of the heights, selling the logs to nearby towns.
København sits on the eastern coast of the island of Zealand.
Lund is a village of København. Villagers brave the storms that sweep through the sea to pull up ample catches of cod, char, and sometimes even small whales.
Älmhult is a village of København. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Åmli is a village of Tunsbergis Castle. This region's rich grasses have made it a good horse country.
Zliten is a village of Bani Walid Castle. Fishermen sail out into the sea for tuna and sardines.
Oujda is a village of Gaouz Castle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Talsint is a village of Gaouz Castle. Villagers grow dates by the coast in gardens watered by wells and small dams in the wadis that trap run-off from the cliffs during the short rainy season.
Chichaoua is a village of Essaouira Castle. The hillside soils make fine grazing for horses.
Safi is a village of Essaouira Castle. This village is near a rich vein of silver in the hills.
Skhira is a village of Younga Castle. Villagers grow dates by the coast in gardens watered by wells and small dams in the wadis that trap run-off from the cliffs during the short rainy season.
El Djem is a village of Younga Castle. Villagers grow dates by the coast in gardens watered by wells and small dams in the wadis that trap run-off from the cliffs during the short rainy season.
Tamalous is a village of Ain Darahim Castle. The seawinds bring just enough rain to support the cultivation of olive trees.
Aïn Oussera is a village of Kaoua Castle. The sides of the hills are terraced to grow wheat, with cisterns to catch the rain blowing up from the sea.
Beni Mellal is a village of Taourirt Castle. Villagers grow dates by the coast in gardens watered by wells and small dams in the wadis that trap run-off from the cliffs during the short rainy season.
Midelt is a village of Taourirt Castle. The villagers grow olives on the warm, dry landward side of the hills.
Tétouan is a village of Almahdiyya Castle. Decent clay can be found in the small streams that rush down from the hills.
Rjim Maatoug is a village of Nalut Castle. The hillside soils make fine grazing for horses.
El Oued, the name is taken from the local word for river. The town sits southwest of the Salt Lakes Chott Melrhir and Chott Felrhir, watered by an underground river.
Oum Touyour is a village of El Oued. Villagers catch a variety of fish from the salt lake.
Taibet is a village of El Oued. Villagers sink wells here to tap the groundwater, using it to irrigate their olive groves.
Zarzis is a village of Bani Walid Castle. The seawinds bring just enough rain to support the cultivation of olive trees.
Biskra is a village of El Oued. Villagers grow dates by the coast in gardens watered by wells and small dams in the wadis that trap run-off from the cliffs during the short rainy season.
Béchar sits in the northern Africa. The rocky highlands overlook the town from the east. The west, by contrast, is a flat rocky territory.
Aïn El Orak is a village of Kaoua Castle. The hillside soils make fine grazing for horses.
Bouarfa is a village of Béchar. Villagers grow dates by the coast in gardens watered by wells and small dams in the wadis that trap run-off from the cliffs during the short rainy season.
Abadla is a village of Béchar. Farmland is limited here, and the land is best known for the horses that are grazed on the desert's short-lived but rich spring grasses.
Marrakech sits in the foothills of the Atlas Mountains, in northwest Africa.
Settat is a village of Marrakech. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Azzaba is a village of Ain Darahim Castle. Coastal meadows, where tall grasses tolerant of the ocean salt spray thrive, support the rearing of fine horses.
Khouribga is a village of Marrakech. Decent clay can be found in the small streams that rush down from the hills.
Tunis sits on the south coast of the Mediterranean Sea, in North Africa.
Zaghouan is a village of Tunis. Though fishing is poor in these parts, villagers have constructed salt pans that stick far out into the shallow waters.
Siliana is a village of Tunis. Villagers grow dates by the coast in gardens watered by wells and small dams in the wadis that trap run-off from the cliffs during the short rainy season.

Laghouat sits in the Amour Range of the Saharan Atlas, on the north edge of the Sahara Desert.

Taznakht is a village of Zagora. The surrounding lands, though dry, produce enough grass in the spring to allow the breeding of horses.

Guercif is a village of Zagora. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.

Tifelt is a village of Rabat. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Benslimane is a village of Rabat. The village depends primarily on fishing, pulling black bass from the lake waters.

Riazan is a village of Moscow Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Korosten is a village of Kyiv. The villagers trap beaver, marten, and rabbit for their pelts.
Mazyr is a village of Mensk Castle. This region's rich grasses have made it a good horse country.
Tchornobyl is a village of Kyiv. The villagers set nets in the river to catch a variety of fish.
Volodymyr sits north of the Southern Bug river, in the East European Plain.
Białowieża is a village of Volodymyr. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Krasnystaw is a village of Volodymyr. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.
Viljandi is a village of Narva Castle. Villagers net small spiny perch and crayfish in the streams, drying them for sale to travelers.
Halych sits north of the Prut river, in the East European Plain.
Svaliava is a village of Halych. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Kolomyia is a village of Halych. The villagers set nets in the river to catch a variety of fish.
Riga lies on the Gulf of Riga at the mouth of the Daugava river where it meets the Baltic Sea.
Šiauliai is a village of Riga. Villagers net small spiny perch and crayfish in the streams, drying them for sale to travelers.
Rostov Veliki is a village of Moscow Castle. The villagers trap beaver, marten, and rabbit for their pelts.
Daugavpils is a village of Riga. The villagers of this region specialize in the raising of pigs.
Jelgava is a village of Riga. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.
Polotsk lies on the Daugava river, in the East European Plain.
Hlybokaïe is a village of Polotsk. Snow-bound for much of the year, the spring grasses nonetheless sustain sizeable herds of sheep, the thick wool of which protects them from this land's icy winds.
Choumilina is a village of Polotsk. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Orel is a village of Kozelsk Castle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Novgorod lies on the Lake Ilmen, in the East European Plain.
Valdaï is a village of Novgorod. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Velikié Louki is a village of Novgorod. The villagers trap beaver, marten, and rabbit for their pelts.
Sankt-Peterbourg is a village of Novgorod. Villagers harvest the tall trees of the heights, selling the logs to nearby towns.
Tcherepovets lies on the Sheksna river, which is a tributary of the Volga river.
Voznesenye is a village of Tcherepovets. The village depends primarily on fishing, pulling perch, bream, salmon, and occasionally large sturgeon and pike from the lake waters.
Bejetsk is a village of Tcherepovets. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Radomychl is a village of Kamianets-Podilskyi Castle. The hillside soils make fine grazing for horses.
Wałbrzych is a village of Grodno Castle. Villagers have made intensive efforts to grow mulberry bushes here to raise silkworms, a lucrative product in this region.
Chrudim is a village of Grodno Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Coimbra sits in the eastern Iberian Peninsula, east of the Atlantic Ocean.
Fundão is a village of Coimbra. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Miranda do Corvo is a village of Coimbra. This land is rich in wheat.
Bergen stands in southwestern the Scandinavian Peninsula and west of the southern part of the Scandinavian Mountains, surrounded by mountains.
Ghadames, known as 'the pearl of the desert', sits in an oasis of North Africa.
El Borma is a village of Ghadames. Villagers grow dates by the coast in gardens watered by wells and small dams in the wadis that trap run-off from the cliffs during the short rainy season.
Sinawin is a village of Ghadames. This region's rich grasses have made it a good horse country.
Kirkwall sits on the northern coast of the Mainland, Orkney Islands.
Stromness is a village of Kirkwall. Decent clay can be found in the small streams that rush down from the hills.
Canisbay is a village of Kirkwall. Decent clay can be found in the small streams that rush down from the hills.
Galway sits on the coast of the Atlantic Ocean, in the west of Ireland Island.
Roscommon is a village of Galway. Decent clay can be found in the small streams that rush down from the hills.
Loughrea is a village of Galway. Decent clay can be found in the small streams that rush down from the hills.
Al-Madīna sits in the wide strip between the Nafud desert and the Red Sea.
Al Quds sits on the southern spur of the plateau in the Judaean Mountains between the Mediterranean and the Dead Sea, surrounded by valleys and wadis.
Dimašq stands in a strategic site on a plateau, near the Judaean Mountains and the Anti-Lebanon mountains.
Halab sits on a plateau, east of the Euphrates river, west of the Mediterranean Sea.
Zawilah sits in the North Africa.
Taraghin is a village of Zawilah. Villagers trap rainwater and runoff from the hills to water their fields and their gardens of date palms.
Mourzouq is a village of Zawilah. Barren most of the year except for scrub, it is covered in grass and flowers in the spring and is fine grazing for horses.
Al Kufrah sits in the North Africa. The region has a hot desert climate.
At Tallab is a village of Al Kufrah. The villagers here sink wells to water their groves of date palms.
Buzaymah is a village of Al Kufrah. This region's rich grasses have made it a good horse country.
Koutaïssi sits southwest of the Caucasus Mountains, east of the Black Sea.
Poti is a village of Koutaïssi. Decent clay can be found in the small streams that rush down from the hills.
Akhalkalaki is a village of Koutaïssi. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Karapınar is a village of Konya. Decent clay can be found in the small streams that rush down from the hills.
Beyşehir is a village of Konya. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Stavropol is a village of Stavropol Castle. Villagers, who not long ago still lived a nomadic lifestyle, raise sheep in the foothills.
Elista is a village of Stavropol Castle. The hillside soils make fine grazing for horses.
Sarov is a village of Kstovo. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.
Jytomyr is a village of Soroca Castle. This village is near a rich vein of silver in the hills.
Kropyvnytsky is a village of Mykolaiv Castle. This district specializes in the harvest of timber which is floated down the river and sold to nearby towns.
Labinsk is a village of Yeni-Kale Castle. Decent clay can be found in the small streams that rush down from the hills.
Koursk is a village of Saburovskaya Castle. Villagers, who not long ago still lived a nomadic lifestyle, raise sheep in the foothills.
Belgorod is a village of Saburovskaya Castle. The villagers, who until recently were nomads, raise sheep known for the long, fine wool.
Malye Derbety is a village of Astrakhan Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Selivanovskaya is a village of Bakhmout Castle. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.

Penza is a village of Tambov Castle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Derbent sits on the west coast of the Caspian Sea, east of the Caucasus Mountains, connecting the Eurasian Steppe to the north and the Iranian Plateau to the south.
Vladikavkaz is a village of Derbent. Villagers, who not long ago still lived a nomadic lifestyle, raise sheep in the foothills.
Groznyï is a village of Derbent. Villagers trap run-off water from the hills and grow flax in the lowlands here.
Novopokrovka is a village of Mykolaiv Castle. Villagers, who not long ago still lived a nomadic lifestyle, specialize in the rearing of horses.
Neftekoumsk is a village of Derbent. The hillside soils make fine grazing for horses.
Elets lies on the Bystraya Sosna river, which is a tributary of the Don river.
Ostrogojsk is a village of Elets. Villagers, who not long ago still lived a nomadic lifestyle, specialize in the rearing of horses.

Chakhty is a village of Bakhmout Castle. Decent clay can be found in the small streams that rush down from the hills.
Vinnytsia is a village of Soroca Castle. Villagers, who not long ago still lived a nomadic lifestyle, raise sheep in the foothills.
Hadjibey sits on the northwestern coast of the Black Sea.
Sarata is a village of Hadjibey. The village makes its living from mining nearby salt deposits.
Tiraspol is a village of Hadjibey. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.
Domaniwka is a village of Hadjibey. The villagers set nets in the river to catch a variety of fish.

Kirovskoye is a village of Kerch. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Bilmak is a village of Kerch. Villagers, who not long ago still lived a nomadic lifestyle, raise sheep in the foothills.
Verkhnii is a village of Kerch. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.

Kanach is a village of Kazan. Villagers, who not long ago still lived a nomadic lifestyle, specialize in the rearing of horses.
Bouïnsk is a village of Kazan. The villagers, who until recently were nomads, raise sheep known for the long, fine wool.

Jokkmokk is a village of Årøybukt Castle. The low-lying lands are suited to the growing of flax.

Överkalix is a village of Åbergs Castle. This region's rich grasses have made it a good horse country.
Kiruna is a village of Stekenjokk Castle. The villagers in these parts are expert trappers, hunting marten, fox, and rabbit for the pelts.
Jukkasjärvi is a village of Stekenjokk Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Rovaniemi is a village of Oulu Castle. The low-lying lands are suited to the growing of flax.
Ranua is a village of Oulu Castle. The villagers in these parts are expert trappers, hunting marten, fox, and rabbit for the pelts.
Kajaani is a village of Olavinlinna Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.

Souoïarvi is a village of Segezha Castle. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Turku sits on the coast of the Baltic Sea, in southern Fennoscandia.
Laihia is a village of Turku . The villagers in these parts are expert trappers, hunting marten, fox, and rabbit for the pelts.
Gällivare is a village of Årøybukt Castle. This region's rich grasses have made it a good horse country.
Vantaa is a village of Turku . Villagers here fish for tuna, sardines, bonito, and sharks.
Skellefteå sits on the coast of the Gulf of Bothnia, in the northeastern Scandinavian Peninsula.
Älvsbyn is a village of Skellefteå. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Lycksele is a village of Skellefteå. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.
Joensuu is a village of Olavinlinna Castle. The village depends primarily on fishing, pulling perch, bream, salmon, and occasionally large sturgeon and pike from the lake waters.
Hammerfest sits on the coast of the Norwegian Sea, in the northern Scandinavian Peninsula.
Kvænangsbotn is a village of Hammerfest. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Alta is a village of Hammerfest. Villagers brave the storms that sweep through the sea to pull up ample catches of cod, char, and sometimes even small whales.
Vågan sits on the coast of the Norwegian Sea, in the northwestern Scandinavian Peninsula.
Harstad is a village of Vågan. Villagers brave the storms that sweep through the sea to pull up ample catches of cod, char, and sometimes even small whales.
Kostomoukcha is a village of Segezha Castle. The villagers in these parts are expert trappers, hunting marten, fox, and rabbit for the pelts.
Narvik is a village of Vågan. The villagers of this region specialize in the raising of pigs.
Abisko is a village of Vågan. The mines of this district supply the iron ore for many of the forges of the kingdom.
Vyborg sits on the east coast of the east Gulf of Finland.
Kotka is a village of Vyborg. The villagers here make most of their income from the raising of sheep.
Savonlinna is a village of Vyborg. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Mieraslompola is a village of Kovdor Castle. This is among the most fertile of the kingdom and produces a fine crop of wheat.
Ivalo lies on the Lake Inari, in the northern of the Scandinavian Peninsula.
Karasjok is a village of Ivalo. The people of these parts have raised cattle, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travelers passing through the region.
Sirkka is a village of Ivalo. The villagers in these parts are expert trappers, hunting marten, fox, and rabbit for the pelts.
Lokka is a village of Ivalo. Many of the villagers work as foresters, harvesting pine for sale to the towns.
Kirkenes sits on the coast of the Barents Sea, in the northern Scandinavian Peninsula.
Nellim is a village of Kirkenes. The village depends primarily on fishing, pulling perch, bream, salmon, and occasionally large sturgeon and pike from the lake waters.
